mods.abstract: Photograph on Page 71 shows two men loading grasses, probable lespedeza, on the back of a horse-drawn wagon. A mechanical loader sits at the foot of the wagon.
mods.note: Alternate view of this photograph found on Page 15, image 130.; Compare photograph to the following publication. Dodson, W.R. (1911, September) Lespedeza or Japan Clover. Louisiana Bulletin, No. 130, p. 54. Photograph is captioned, "Mechanical loader loading lespedeza, with some grass. Experiment Station, Baton Rouge." Retrieved August 4, 2014, from http://books.google.com/books?id=de42AQAAIAAJ&pg=RA5-PA1&lpg=RA5-PA1&dq=Louisiana+Bulletin+No.+130+1911+Dodson&source=bl&ots=2rOHUxPJUa&sig=n32VJFq6oJR99Jyfmtrvi46E-hY&hl=en&sa=X&ei=ZyrEU7D0AeXo8QGdj4DQDg&ved=0CCUQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=Sherwood&f=false
